channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.description:
Report E-2024040388

item.title: Report X-2024040763
item.description:
Report X-2024040763

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND IN A PLASTIC BAG IN FRONT OF A VAN. IT APPEARS THAT THE CAP TO THE JUG WAS LOOSE CAUSING THE LEAKAGE. DescribePack: THE CAP TO ONE OF THE JUGS WAS LOOSE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The Sulfamic Acid was bundled inside of three garbage bags. Everything was then placed into a plastic HazMat bag and HazMat tote. Everything was then moved to the QA Repack Station.

Report X-2024040535

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: An unloader was unloading a trailer when the package was leaking to which they put in a tote with a hazmat bag over the leaking package. DescribePack: The items cap was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Replace the old hazmat bag with a new one to cover up the package and put it in a hazmat drum.

item.title: Report X-2024040639
item.description:
Report X-2024040639

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to the damage cage for further inspection, box was wet. DescribePack: Upon inspection, I found contents leaking trough the lids, causing internal leak and damaging the box, soiling contents. Package did not have enough inner packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was separated, placed in a tote and taken to the hazmat cage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: box was discovered on the unload side leaking on one side. it was placed into a Hazmat bag a brought to QA for inspection and processing DescribePack: The two bottles were heavily dented but were not punctured anywhere. The lids were intact. i believe the bottles had too much pressure on them which forced the fluid out. despite intact lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: i just processed the item when it arrived at QA

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was initially noticed on a van after it had been out for delivery. The smell of the liquid was noticeable immediately upon entering the van. The package was then taken to the damage cage. DescribePack: There are three wet spots on the package, about 4"x2" each. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was brought to the damage cage and placed under the hood.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking during the loading of a trailer and was promptly placed into a lined HazMat tote. DescribePack: Loose caps caused the container to leak.
